intro: Haplopappus microcephalus, commonly known as the small-headed pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and wind-dispersed seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of numerous small yellow florets. The species is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
